Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

ReferenceHash: e5298d9dc20c2ada61b9a2845662c41838bbd302512857fdbc7297a546f93a0e
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 2c5335b2a3fb7f0446c3fa9f753cf197926cfeca10c17ee62ceb489fdf260176
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110

ReferenceHash: 833f9f5251849021ace621d862f6759c0110b4d44085a666e4b1e4bcb9e449a8
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: d393517fcae6f6c9d73026147cd30f4e388dabd16d9b18fafbfa04fbe5731a78
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 02674af8d90fbbe021bc5825d5a471989a58e4afb59d6dcc4fe1547a021b335b
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 846ed7f346393768d1c067da8dddd49d70f885fd8d372fdfaa9d3ffda376cb24
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 3173ad911730d6ea1a7898843e4af260f290fe4da1cae90610c92791a40d64df
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: f480c95af703fac24e6624a2323e17d173b4770f0a39df692e6fc3ea1fd06397
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Language: Java
Severity: HIGH
Line: 67
Column: 40
SecurityTool: HorusecEngine
Confidence: LOW
File: C:\Users\Utilizador\Desktop\WorkTime\Tese\OWASPBenchamarkHURUSEC\Nova pasta\crypto\noissueexpected\BenchmarkTest00944.java
Code: javax.crypto.Cipher c = javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance("DESEDE/ECB/PKCS5Padding");
RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: af88852d0ae4f8def66bd2c78594cc6a055a95e35a9b9f566fbf22dce5f61fa7
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Language: Java
Severity: HIGH
Line: 74
Column: 40
SecurityTool: HorusecEngine
Confidence: LOW
File: C:\Users\Utilizador\Desktop\WorkTime\Tese\OWASPBenchamarkHURUSEC\Nova pasta\crypto\issueexpected\BenchmarkTest00691.java
Code: javax.crypto.Cipher c = javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance("DES/CBC/PKCS5Padding");
RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 6ed1c129145ca9509745274d30dd5f4c1f6eff976731b51f991fa0f68d9c8eb9
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 96a9b6cbc74cdd3c89d3a46c0f1ceef7f46d2e8a87f6c224993cbbdc7a8e1d70
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 484f515ad8efa0cbd4dcf39c7e5360e422d8fba2b2493e9a90b3eeaeebdeb419
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

 Crypto import

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 554723261331b9a8c94ffffbbed5868d33d9c0cbed9a292d703f6138145fffcb
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: d222fb857422d47839a8bce16a4fca325a5ab6328976cc26c4cc4395018e27d7
Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

 Crypto import

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

ReferenceHash: f373f9029728fe7e5f6a379d0fd02b57fbe9583c403282635340d8705a267476
Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. (2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: fb65e7fe8a24abaae9d7c428f60e93cf65dab94bededd392f034311352611552
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Language: Java

Code: javax.crypto.Cipher c = javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance("DES/CBC/PKCS5Padding");
RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: b8ba955626b1c0527b80c68bb3a4761cef166d4e7e448aef8eacd0344f909b86
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 8f5a6412c9afbbb0ca773aca02e204af688814bc8acb11532aac4afd04ecf00a
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: c3f8f0e54b6c2a98af122c7099ef6652d714b01effba65d81b29c665e1d07836
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

 Crypto import

DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

ReferenceHash: 675f251946f536406d14f90e56fe4b63cca2745465d04c4cb64ccd46aedd7980
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

Type: Vulnerability

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 02466b584674ceccacd2f8579165244ff01a89d1c18b8f921ca7e176ff1bad43
Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. Type: Vulnerability

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 2d2d4f2dadeb8bbc250848741a7eddd4ddee1a9aeeb63b0bdfa64c121be1742b
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 6cf17786aa5ac46dd25a1f330071ede7aead7d4c4c167821797edd5921cfa5b6
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 0e6c289fffa18268f7dd2b4371eb1f9361bfcb1aaa91b9a0eda525564212ee33
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

Type: Vulnerability

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: e93a1dab6c1d07650006c67f17888faffc9531cdb57c194e619d6f51f32d25f2
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 7d7e2be6596cf2e8dadd37cd417c4255751edcab385e05724f9315817457c6c4
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

ReferenceHash: fe4ac51bbc5816724313aedafe2dbc3b63198047cb9775ae3d204eb05e88b3db
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

Line: 64

Code: stance("DES/CBC/PKCS5PADDING", java.security.Security.getProvider("SunJCE"));
RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 0117282dff39a146342eb9ee84a0c1f9a9c4ede698031fd07c47e0fbe0d8fcdc
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: f51d5f68a6abae6b245555ca18254c7fd07ada540f2a5dd3f1c222998b467e6d
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 284084f024cd100b9358216e630bb06872f52a67c9ceb7b1b0022b4a673f6e75
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 7687f36cbb75734e1f43e772b002113e8380d7fdcd20f88ada2945ac61615eec
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 801f1d3ff9fb077663a67362e439e29d834893475aff87b53e9352ec620ee48a
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 3bcc4d42320b9b7545e55cc94f94325374f0d67ab135596ff796b6428fa044e9
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 99783a126326d61aca158f52dc1af9fbfb6e363afee5594346a0942dd20313b8
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

ReferenceHash: ab42457b5023f1e1e3c67fbffd35583294e5771040f3e77a01a0955a5b34a763
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: d4f270aaf319c6a5a0ad6cfd8e2d1f21713effa40d34a0c1dc01e6c25f3fbc35
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Language: Java
Severity: HIGH
Line: 72
Column: 49
SecurityTool: HorusecEngine
Confidence: LOW
File: C:\Users\Utilizador\Desktop\WorkTime\Tese\OWASPBenchamarkHURUSEC\Nova pasta\crypto\issueexpected\BenchmarkTest00254.java
Code: stance("DES/CBC/PKCS5PADDING", java.security.Security.getProvider("SunJCE"));
RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: afe1daee3891aeb2da42c7538e88fac64401bffc3877be47a7a3216ca0ef529c
Details: (1/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/2) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. Language: Java
Severity: HIGH
Line: 57
Column: 40
SecurityTool: HorusecEngine
Confidence: LOW
File: C:\Users\Utilizador\Desktop\WorkTime\Tese\OWASPBenchamarkHURUSEC\Nova pasta\crypto\noissueexpected\BenchmarkTest01324.java

RuleID: HS-JAVA-110
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 3c221bc66708c3e3406d0712f5e5073127574ed797842e69f5ee51d4ec65cb8e
Details: (1/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak block mode for Cryptographic Hash Function
A weak ECB, (a.k.a 'block mode') was found in one of your Ciphers. Always use a strong, high entropy hash, for example the SHA-512 with salt options. For more information check CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html), CWE-719 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/719.html), CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) and CWE-780 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/780.html) for deeper details on how to fix it.
         
(2/3) * Possible vulnerability detected:  Crypto import
 Crypto import
         
(3/3) * Possible vulnerability detected: DES, DESede, RSA is insecure
DES is considered strong ciphers for modern applications. Currently, NIST recommends the usage of AES block ciphers instead of DES. For more information checkout the CWE-326 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/326.html) advisory

Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: SQL Injection
The input values included in SQL queries need to be passed in safely. Bind variables in prepared statements can be used to easily mitigate the risk of SQL injection. Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

ReferenceHash: 84058470ebad6116b8e930f9008474f82d3e38abd616fb8dbf9b52d4b5537ae8
Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: Weak Cryptographic Hash Function used
Using a weak CHF pose a threat to your application security since it can be vulnerable to a number of attacks that could lead to data leaking, improper access of features and resources of your infrastructure and even rogue sessions. For more information checkout the CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html) advisory.

Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

ReferenceHash: 737aaf08f98d22d1a6187be02223cc06a0fcb988dc3172fe46aa556764ba4c0f
Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: SQL Injection
The input values included in SQL queries need to be passed in safely. Bind variables in prepared statements can be used to easily mitigate the risk of SQL injection. Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

The input values included in SQL queries need to be passed in safely. Bind variables in prepared statements can be used to easily mitigate the risk of SQL injection. Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

For more information checkout the CWE-327 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/327.html) advisory.

Code: javax.naming.directory.SearchControls sc = new javax.naming.directory.SearchControls();
RuleID: HS-JAVA-148
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 972ae932e3f658411199bee5496d2b1ce709a3c776ee0e84d0c134a367003d4d
Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: LDAP deserialization should be disabled
JNDI supports the deserialization of objects from LDAP directories, which is fundamentally insecure and can lead to remote code execution. This rule raises an issue when an LDAP search query is executed with SearchControls configured to allow deserialization. For more information checkout the CWE-502 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/502.html) advisory.

RuleID: HS-JAVA-148
Type: Vulnerability
ReferenceHash: 972ae932e3f658411199bee5496d2b1ce709a3c776ee0e84d0c134a367003d4d
Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: LDAP deserialization should be disabled
JNDI supports the deserialization of objects from LDAP directories, which is fundamentally insecure and can lead to remote code execution. This rule raises an issue when an LDAP search query is executed with SearchControls configured to allow deserialization. For more information checkout the CWE-502 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/502.html) advisory.

Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

The input values included in SQL queries need to be passed in safely. Bind variables in prepared statements can be used to easily mitigate the risk of SQL injection. Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

ReferenceHash: 7843cd41812624cfcf7daa185bc808eec0af209db413902a5f84300ecc93f268

The input values included in SQL queries need to be passed in safely. Bind variables in prepared statements can be used to easily mitigate the risk of SQL injection. Alternatively to prepare statements, each parameter can be escaped manually. For more information checkout the CWE-89 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/89.html) advisory.

Details: (1/1) * Possible vulnerability detected: XPath expressions should not be vulnerable to injection attacks
User provided data, such as URL parameters, should always be considered untrusted and tainted. Constructing XPath expressions directly from tainted data enables attackers to inject specially crafted values that changes the initial meaning of the expression itself. Successful XPath injection attacks can read sensitive information from XML documents. For more information checkout the CWE-643 (https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/643.html) advisory
